data.title: make GraphNode inherit VBoxContainer
data.body:
This allows children in GraphNode to use the EXPAND size flags, making its sizing behaviour more consistent.

Side effect is that BoxContainer now reads the frame stylebox for margins.

data.title: Instancing a custom type throws an error
data.body:
When instancing a custom type created by a script plugin
I get this error

```
ERROR: instance: Condition ' !ti ' is true. returned: __null
   At: core/object_type_db.cpp:283.
ERROR: _create: Condition ' !c ' is true.
   At: tools/editor/scene_tree_dock.cpp:1075.
```

I'm not sure what to do about this error.

**Here is all the code**
https://github.com/LeonardMeagher2/Godot-Assets/tree/master/Plugins/Trails

**Here is a gif to sort of demonstrate the situation**

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1546044/8197480/5e23dbe6-144d-11e5-994a-b4954c79b616.gif)

data.title: Fix for issue related to GridMap editor
data.body: closes #2102

data.title: set_name doesn't work if used with a name of queue_freed scene
data.body:
I can select a node in my scene and delete it, but instancing and adding a new scene and changing its name to be the same as the deleted one's doesn't work. In other words, the engine doesn't permit using the name of the old node even though the node doesn't exist anymore.

```
func loadscene(scene):
    var nn = get_node("NamedNode")  
    nn.queue_free()
    var inst = scene.instance()
    add_child(inst)
    print("instance name before setting: ", inst.get_name())
    inst.set_name("NamedNode")
    print("instance name after setting: ", inst.get_name())
```

Produces:

```
instance name before setting: Node2D
instance name after setting: @Node2D5
```

data.title: Godot crash when deleting gridmap
data.body:
On linux, with the v1.1.stable.custom_build : 
I create a gridmap, I set the theme, I insert some tiles, I switch to another object, then I return on the gridmap and I deleting. Godot ask me if I want to delete the node, and when I click on ok, it crash. When I reopen the project,

I can delete the gridmap without crash, it's only when I create, insert, deselect, reselect and delete.

Tested with two tilesets, the issue appears on both.

data.title: Pr-Script editor
data.body: Script editor: restore line/column after script reload

data.title: script horizontal scrolling broken
data.body: This seems to be related to the new dock layout, with docks on the left side of the window.  The script editor won't scroll all the way to the right unless you move the cursor there.  It's missing about the same distance as the width of the left dock, which makes me think the dock area is not being taken into account.

data.title: Better Character Controller demo with 3D KinematicBody that's ready to use in user project
data.body: Something like [Unity's Character Controller](http://docs.unity3d.com/Manual/class-CharacterController.html) would be a great addition. It would lower the entry barrier greatly.

data.title: Grid/Tile map editor new item palette
data.body:
Changed the Grid/Tile map editor item palette from a Tree widget to a ItemList widget. Adding new features to the palette like the item name at bottom of preview, the number of columns are defined by the width of the widget, and list view of the items.

And bind the "set_item_metadata" and "get_item_metada" methods of ItemList.

data.title: Collision detection betwen KinematicBody2D and StaticBody2D and KinematicBody2D unreliable
data.body: Collision detection between a KinematicBody2D and StaticBody2D or KinematicBody2D is unreliable, that is a KinematicBody2D sometimes enters and gets stuck in another KinematicBody2D or it passes through a StaticBody2D. This happens with Godot 1.1. I've created a minimal example at http://code.guido-berhoerster.org/tmp/BugReproducer.tar.gz to reproduce the problem which bounces a KinematicBody2D ball around a playing field delimited by StaticBody2D walls with a randomly moving KinematicBody2D paddle, it just needs to run a couple of minutes and will pause automatically once the ball either moves inside the paddle or passes through a wall.

data.title: Big FPS drop with Sprite3D as ground and 14 omnilights
data.body:
In my example, the grass which is the background for everything else.
I've tried one big Sprite3D (13x26m), but noticed that this eats about 30 FPS in fullscreen, as compared to no visible ground at all.
Then I've tried many smaller sprites (2.6x2.6m) to cover the same area, which eats "only" about 15 FPS, but still way too much...
What is strange is that only the ground makes this huge difference in FPS. All the other sprites in the game seem to hardly make a difference in FPS if I enable or disable them.
All of them, including the ground, are shaded and receive shadows.

![screenshot from 2015-05-28 19 44 15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1307146/8162614/c072bda0-137e-11e5-9b78-e4ec1688245a.png)

data.title: Huge performance loss when compiling Godot from source
data.body:
When compiling Godot from source on Ubuntu 14.04 it roughly half of its performance. Everything in the editor takes twice as long. And when building and running a game with that custom Godot build, the game also runs much much slower than the official build.

This is a persistent problem, not just with a specific revision from GitHub. 
http://www.godotengine.org/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=1482&p=10020#p10020
And at least one other person described the same problem in the Facebook group, but I have no link to that post.

I followed the instrucions here: https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/compiling_linux

Should I provide the output of the scons command?

Should I provide my compiled binary so you can see how slow it runs?

Could you provide automated nightly builds on the Godot website? That would also solve this problem and make it easier for other people too to use the latest version.

data.title: Full screen resolution change in runtime
data.body:
Linux Mint 17.1 "Rebecca" Cinnamon, nVidia (additionally tested on Intel), Godot 1.1 (release)

I was trying to make user settings to change the screen resolution in the game for Godot. Just as is done in other PC games: http://savepic.org/7373870.htm

I tried to use the method: OS.set_video_mode(~), - but it's not working. Other tools I not found.

Why is this method not working?
Will it work in a future release?
Is there another way to switch the screen resolution?

data.title: Game crashes upon mouse enters the window
data.body:
I'm using godot version 1.1 stable, and installed the latest export scripts. When I export my game with the debug flag enabled (for Windows), it works fine. But when I export the game in release mode, when the mouse cursor enters the game window, the game crashes.

I gave the game to two more people and the two of them experienced the same problem, which is a big problem.

Hovering the mouse cursor during debug mode doesn't display anything relevant about it. But when I am in the editor and I run the game, I get the following error:

**ERROR: set_Stream_peer: Condition ' p_peer.is_null() ' is true.
At: core/io/packet_peer.cpp:288**

I also get another one:

**ERROR: free_static: Condition ' !MemoryPoolStatic::get_singleton() ' is true.
At: core/os/memory.cpp:58**

My system is a Core 2 Duo with 2GB of RAM, the OS is Windows 8.1 x86 (32 bit).

data.title: pile of rigidbody2d's = lots of ugly intersections
data.body:
Dump a bunch of rigibody2d's with rectangle collision shapes into a pit so they pile on top of each other, and the ones at the bottom are forced into each other.  They overlap significantly, and constantly shake around as they try to resolve their colliisions.

Example:
https://copy.com/YWldXOFC18N1oYRk

data.title: added pause_process to VisibilityEnabler2D
data.body:
I don't know if this is something that should be present within the engine but it helped me in my project.
Note: I don't think it's possible right now to create a "pause process" and "pause fixed process" because of the way the enabler its implemented.

data.title: fix register Physics2DTestMotionResult not virtual
CollisionObject function to get name of shape source node
data.body:
String get_shape_source(index)
property to CollisionObject so the name of the node it comes from can be retrieved in runtime

Thanks..

data.title: Fixed variables being set before calling the setter method
data.body:
Fixes issue #2077.

Re-upload of #2083, except moved into a forked branch. First time doing a pull request, so I didn't think to use a branch.

data.title: Undo errors when shader editor is open
data.body:
When the shader editor is open and you edit something else in the scene, if you try to undo the scene changes it will ALSO undo the changes done to the shader.

That's very likely to cause data loss if one is not aware of it.

Tested in 2D scenes, untested in 3D.

data.title: The ability to change enumerable properties by dragging their labels.
data.body: Something that I miss in Godot is the ability to change enumerable properties by dragging their labels. Something like Blender, Unity3D or 3DMax does.

data.title: Implicit methods
data.body:
_init() is implicitly called with new().

In the same way:

``` GDScript
print(my_object) # could implicitly call a function my_object.to_string()
value in my_object # my_object.contains(value)
my_object == value # my_object.equals(value)
my_object[index] # my_object.get_item(index)
# etc etc
```

Like in [Python](https://docs.python.org/3/reference/datamodel.html#special-method-names)
It's always fun to use. :)

data.title: Reparenting nodes with drag & drop
data.body:
I think this could speed the workflow a lot.
Drag a node, drop it on it's new parent, and done!

What do you think?

data.body: Fixes issue #2077

data.title: Attach a note/comment to a node
data.body: I'd like to be able to attach a note to any node in the editor.

data.title: Running a script gives a nice, magical screen
data.body:
Using the instructions in https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/command_line#running-a-script I get a magenta (magical pink) window (The scripts does run nevertheless). I think that the window is not needed at all, and it will be better if no window is opened when godot runs with the -s flag... (or maybe a --no-gui flag? :smile: )

OS: Ubuntu-gnome 14-10
GODOT: master

data.title: Hotkey to search the hovered text in the help
data.body: Coming from Game Maker, one of my favorite utilities was pressing middle mouse button on text to search it in the help screen. Shift+F1 does the same function, but having it bound to middle mouse button would be a much more major convenience.

data.title: setter sets the variable before calling the setter
data.body:
```
var variable= 0 setget _variable_set
func _variable_set()
    print(variable)
```

The variable is set before the setter is called, making the setter useless for special set conditions. My use case is:

```
func _dir_set(value):
    if dir != value:
        dir = value.normalized()
        emit_signal(SIGNAL_ANIMATE) # animator is only updated when direction is changed
```

The above code never emits because dir will always equal value.
